title: 1Â  Reference
text:
Git: A distributed version control system, designed to handle collaborative coding projects. A program that is installed on your computer.
GitHub: A cloud-based hosting service that lets you manage Git repositories.
Repo/Repository: A top-level directory that has files tracked by Git is syncronized to GitHub. This directory is access controlled.
Local repo: The folders that are on your computer and are tracked by Git, which you will make changes to.
Remote repo: The centralized repository
Git
[Commit]
[Pull]
[Push]
